abstract: AT&T and Adobe are developing ways to sell applications that will work on many different mobile phones, not just fancy smartphones.
snippet: AT&T and Adobe are developing ways to sell applications that will work on many different mobile phones, not just fancy smartphones.
lead_paragraph: As soon as Apple started selling applications for the iPhone, wireless carriers around the world started to lust after an app store of their own. All those little games and social doodads are, like ring tones, an opportunity for extra sales. And even free apps encourage users to use more wireless data.

headline.main: Coming Next: Mobile Application Stores for the Masses
